subject: Photography
title: Is a Photograph Always True?
description: A micro-lesson that makes Is a Photograph Always True? usable.

hook.text: A photograph shows what was in front of the lens. But framing, timing, and editing can change its meaning entirely.

buildup.text: People trust photographs as evidence. The phrase 'the camera doesn't lie' has been repeated for generations.

discovery.text: But every photo is a choice: what to include, what to crop out, when to press the shutter, what to emphasize.

twist.text: The same event can produce opposite narratives depending on which photograph is published. Context is everything.

climax.text: Photography is not truth ‚Äî it's a version of truth. The photographer's choices shape what 'truth' the viewer receives.

punchline.text: The camera doesn't lie. But it only tells one side.

quiz.question: Why can photographs be misleading even without manipulation?
options: Framing, timing, and cropping choices shape the narrative presented
